intro: Tritonia unguiculata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are pollinated by insects. Tritonia unguiculata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
